page.title: 15The life of Mr Alman 2
page.content: The church is 100 yards from their home.Mr Alman has memories of the second World War,they are the air raid .When the siren went they all had to go in the air raid shelters but if you were on civil defence duty you had to wear steel helmets and a gas mask. When the German bomber went over they dropped a flare which lit up their target so they could see where they were bombing.The rationing was telling the English how much food and things could have.For clothes they had coupons which they had to beg for,and they also had coupons for their wedding clothes.The anxious times were when the Germans were bombing Crewe and the army was on duty amongst it all.The happiest memory was when the war was all over,that was V day.Then there were parties,singing in the street and happy ever after.
